image.altText: People march in purple holding signs at a dv rally

props.synopsis: The NT coroner has announced a second inquiry into domestic violence, before the government has even committed to the recommendations in the first. So what's next in the fight to end the crisis?

title.children: After a landmark inquest, where to next in the effort to end domestic violence?

image.altText: Air Asia X plane close up

props.synopsis: A deal which would have brought more international flights to the Northern Territory has fallen through, with Darwin Airport blaming its ongoing major runway works.

title.children: Darwin Airport blames runway works for Air Asia deal falling over

image.altText: A picture of missing man Richard Roe, smiling and wearing a black rugby jersey.

props.synopsis: Eight years after former concreter Richard Roe disappeared in a rural Northern Territory location, an inquest has ruled that he is deceased and may have died in remote bushland.

title.children: Coronial inquest recommends raising police reward on missing Darwin man to $500,000

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

props.synopsis: Counsel assisting the coroner has made final submissions with scathing accusations of former NT police constable Zachary Rolfe in the inquest into the shooting death of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Zachary Rolfe allegedly held ‘overtly racist attitudes’ and ‘lied’ in court, coroner told

image.altText: A large, wide scar stretching the length of the inner arm of an Aboriginal woman.

props.synopsis: More women die from domestic violence in the Northern Territory than anywhere else in the country. A victim, who is lucky to be alive, speaks out for others who can't.

title.children: 'Stop normalising it': Domestic violence victims in the NT say enough is enough

image.altText: A female judge in a court room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has delivered her findings and recommendations from a landmark coronial inquiry into the domestic violence killings of four Aboriginal women in the territory. She's also announced she'll hold a second major inquiry into the issue.

title.children: NT coroner details 'extent of horror' in landmark DV inquest findings

image.altText: A woman rests her head on another woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: It was two days before Christmas when Mary Malbiynga's little sister was killed by her partner at Darwin's famous Mindil Beach.

title.children: Screams for 20 minutes and no help. Inside the NT's domestic violence tragedy

image.altText: An Indigenous Australian man stands outside a building looking happy.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Aboriginal station workers who had their wages withheld or stolen due to discriminatory government policy will be compensated $16,500 each, the Federal Court rules.

title.children: Aboriginal station workers and their families to share $144 million in stolen wages class action

image.altText: Workers in a broccoli field, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Temporary migrant workers in Australia are facing "disturbing" patterns of exploitation from some employers, the United Nations Special Rapporteur on contemporary forms of slavery, has warned after touring Australia.

title.children: Temporary migrant workers in Australia facing 'disturbing' patterns of exploitation from employers, UN official says

image.altText: A man and woman holding a photo of a woman

props.synopsis: Caitlin Wainrib's death in 2020 was ruled a suicide, but her family believe the police investigation failed to answer questions about her final days. Warning: This story contains references to suicide some audience members may find distressing.

title.children: A missing key, $2,000 and 'bizarre' text messages: The unresolved questions surrounding Caitlin's death

image.altText: Close cropped shot of a street-level power pole and lines

props.synopsis: The Australian Energy Market Commission will crack down on 'concerning practices' by some energy providers amid the rollout of smart meters across the country.

title.children: Power retailers forced to get consent and offer flat rates as energy authority cracks down on murky practice

image.altText: elderly woman wearing a red cardigan and sitting in an armchair in front of a pot with flowers, looking up at the camera

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White tasered 95-year-old Clare Nowland, but the decision to find him guilty of manslaughter was whether or not his actions were reasonably necessary.

title.children: It was never disputed a police officer tasered Clare Nowland, but the manslaughter decision is complex

image.altText: Senate chamber

props.synopsis: The proposal was one of 36 government bills awaiting its fate on the final sitting day of the parliamentary year.

title.children: Election donations reform shelved after Coalition plays last-minute hardball

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Before the last election, Anthony Albanese often talked about "kicking with the wind" in the final quarter. Now, he's talking about "leaving nothing on the field", even if he's leaving a few promises behind in the interests of improving Labor's election chances.

title.children: Albanese is pledging to leave 'nothing on the field' as parliament wraps. He's dropping a few promises, though

image.altText: Qantas takes delivery of A380 Airbus

props.synopsis: The safety regulator has lashed national carrier Qantas over a "cascade of errors" that saw a 1.25-metre tool left in an engine for 300 hours of flying time.

title.children: Qantas called out for process failures and 'cascade of errors' over 1.25m tool left in A380 engine

image.altText: A car parked on a beach.

props.synopsis: Residents of Cervantes are being told to evacuate immediately, with a massive fire that was first sparked by a car crash threatening the small fishing town.

title.children: Entire town told to evacuate in massive emergency bushfire north of Perth

image.altText: A woman sits on a couch against a wall that has many photo frames.

props.synopsis: News of dangerous animal encounters tend to travel very fast in Australia, but the sometimes "racist" victim blaming that follows can compound the mental anguish of survivors.

title.children: Woman stung by blue-ringed octopus shocked by 'racist' victim blaming on social media

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: First home buyers should be able to borrow more money to get a home loan, according to a federal inquiry into home lending, which is expected to recommend the government ease restrictions on how much banks can lend out.

title.children: 'Stop penalising buyers': Inquiry to suggest it should be easier to get a home loan

image.altText: Donald Trump and Matt Gaetz

props.synopsis: Among those targeted were the US president-elect's pick for US ambassador to the United Nations, and his former pick for attorney-general.

title.children: Trump cabinet picks targeted by bomb threats and 'swatting' attempts, FBI says

image.altText: SES volunteers in hi vis orange uniforms line a road where a hearse carrying a coffin travels by, one volunteer salutes

props.synopsis: As part of an ABC investigation, more than half a dozen emergency sources have claimed the SES volunteers were not needed on the job that day and were unaware a different crew had already assisted the family.

title.children: SES volunteer who drowned on her way to help family from floodwaters was unaware they had already been saved, sources say

image.altText: Two men sitting at a table, with flags behind them, looking on

props.synopsis: Arrest warrants were issued for Benjamin Netanyahu and his former defence minister, Yoav Gallant, as well as a Hamas military leader, last week.

title.children: Israeli PM to appeal International Criminal Court arrest warrant accusing him of war crimes

image.altText: A close up of a man's hand holding an obscured credit card while the other hand types on a laptop.

props.synopsis: With so many retailers spruiking big bargains this month, we're easy targets for fraudsters looking to cash in on the frenzied spending.

title.children: Black Friday sales are ramping up this week. So are scams

image.altText: Despondent-looking man in blue shirt sits on ground next to desk.

props.synopsis: Australians now have the right to disconnect from their employer after hours. But in Japan, thousands of people are dying from overwork. It's a phenomenon called karōshi, and it could happen here, too.

title.children: A religious movement from the 16th century laid the foundations for today's toxic work culture

image.altText: A satelitle image shows rows of buildings on a street.

props.synopsis: The city of El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur in western Sudan, is at the centre of a devastating struggle between two warring factions. Humanitarian groups fear it could have catastrophic consequences.

title.children: Thousands are sheltering in a Sudanese camp. Satellite images from above suggest a paramilitary group is closing in

image.altText: The Webjet homepage, showing a search for flights from Sydney to Melbourne

props.synopsis: The ASX makes solid gains at the open after a sell-off on Wall Street, and the ACCC takes Webjet to court over alleged misleading advertising. Follow the day's events and insights on our live markets blog.

title.children: Webjet taken to court by ACCC over 'false and misleading claims', ASX rises and Bitcoin gains

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX rises at the open, Sigma makes strong gains

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations across open field outside with hills in the distance.

props.synopsis: The amount of money Australians are spending on medicinal cannabis continues to skyrocket, with new data showing this year's sales are on track to double those from 2023.

title.children: Australians spending millions on medicinal cannabis amid 'unacceptable' conflicts of interest by the industry

image.altText: A bucket is full to the brim with many dead beetles bodies.

props.synopsis: A run of hot weather is likely responsible for scarab beetles swarming some homes and business in the ACT region.

title.children: 'I thought it was raining': Swarms of beetles descend on Canberra homes

image.altText: An elderly woman watches as a younger womanm plays with her phone in an office.

props.synopsis: Barb Baird expected better reception at her rural Victorian home when she bought a new phone from Telstra just before last months' 3G shutdown.

title.children: Neighbourhood houses swamped with requests following 3G shutdown as vulnerable people left isolated

image.altText: A drawing of long necked dinosaurs in a leafy scene.

props.synopsis: Using hundreds of samples of fossilised faeces, vomit and intestinal contents, alongside bones and footprints, researchers traced the rise of the dinosaurs over millions of years.

title.children: Fossilised faeces hold clues to how dinosaurs ruled the planet

image.altText: Musician Marilyn Manson is wearing dark eye makeup and lipstick and a black leather coat

props.synopsis: The rocker is accused by multiple women of sexual and psychological assault, but denies any wrongdoing.

title.children: Marilyn Manson drops lawsuit against former fiancee Evan Rachel Wood

image.altText: Phoebe Thorburn stands behind a wooden kitchen bench with their hands on the benchtop, looking happy.

props.synopsis: Phoebe was offered a role that was perfect on paper, but the reality of what it entailed made them rethink what a "dream job" looks like.

title.children: 'I cried all the way home': Why Phoebe said no to their dream job

image.altText: A worker wearing dark clothes using a shovel in deep snow in front of a statue of multiple soldiers

props.synopsis: Up to 26 centimetres of snow fell over northern parts of the South Korean capital, as hundreds of flights were cancelled and homes in multiple areas left without power.

title.children: At least two people killed in heaviest snowstorm to hit Seoul in five decades

image.altText: Jakara Anthony

props.synopsis: Last season, Jakara Anthony completed one of the all-time great campaigns in snow-sport history. But as the wheel continues to turn towards the next Olympics, the 26-year-old remains focused on an elusive goal.

title.children: Following an 'insane' season jam-packed full of success, Jakara Anthony is still chasing more from her sport

image.altText: scaffolding around building next to crane

props.synopsis: Urban planners are calling on regional towns to embrace density and learn to love multi-story developments.

title.children: No longer an affordable option for sea and tree changes, planners say regional NSW needs to build up

image.altText: Kala Gare, a blonde woman in her late 20s, laughs. She's sitting amidst instruments, including a piano.

props.synopsis: Miles Franklin's debut novel may have been published way back in 1901, but the story of the "ratbag" aspiring artist Sybylla Melvyn remains as vibrant as ever.

title.children: My Brilliant Career was written as women fought for suffrage. A new musical brings it into the modern day
